Package common.bounds

Class Bounds2D

java.lang.Object
common.bounds.Bounds2D
public class Bounds2D
extends java.lang.Object
Aerial, or spatial bounds (e.g. a rectangle).

    • expandTo

      public void expandTo​(Bounds2D other)
      Updates the bounding x,y values from the Bounds2D. More specifically, if any x,y values in the Bounds2D lie outside of the existing values for the Bounds2D, the bounds values will be used.
      Parameters:
      other - Bounds2D used to update bounds.

    • expandTo

      public void expandTo​(double x, double y)
      Update the bounding values from the x, y location.
      Parameters:
      x - x to update bounds.
      y - y to update bounds.

      yArray - array of Y coordinates

      public void expandTo​(double srcMinX, double srcMaxX, double srcMinY, double srcMaxY)
      Updates the bounds from the specified coordinate range.
      Parameters:
      srcMinX - the minimum X coordinate of the range
      srcMaxX - the maximum X coordinate of the range
      srcMinY - the minimum Y coordinate of the range
      srcMaxY - the maximum Y coordinate of the range

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • setValues

      public void setValues​(double minX, double maxX, double minY, double maxY)
      Sets the bounding coordinates explicitly, regardless of whether these parameters lie inside or outside the existing coordinate ranges.
      Parameters:
      minX - new minimum X coordinate
      maxX - new minimum X coordinate
      minY - new minimum Y coordinate
      maxY - new minimum Y coordinate

    • setXValues

    • setYValues

    • expandByPercentage

      public boolean expandByPercentage​(double pct)
      Expands (or contracts) the bounds by a percentage. Bounds will expand if pct argument is greater than 0, and contract if pct argument is less than 0. Each dimension is expanded by the specified percentage of itself. For example, passing in 10.0 for the pct parameter will change extents from [0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 100.0, 200.0, 300.0] to [-5.0, -10.0, -15.0, 105.0, 210.0, 315.0]. If the current bounds are not valid, nothing is changed and false is returned.
      Parameters:
      pct - the percentage to expand.
      Returns:
      true if expansion worked, false otherwise.

    • expandWidthByPercentage

      public boolean expandWidthByPercentage​(double pct)

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Returns:
      false if any value (minX, minY, maxX, maxY) is == Dval.DVAL_DOUBLE, OR if minX >= maxX OR minY >= maxY, true otherwise.
